Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two faded added white bands; exterior: part of elaborate rosette in brownish outline, with dark brown centre in alternate petals; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, a set of sherds which display patterns on the different parts of the vessel which are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72). For parallels regarding the rosette, see Lemos, no. 236 from Vulci.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 239, no. 188)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0132) (phase 2)
